intro: Nitrosalsola acanthoclada, commonly known as the spiny nitrosalsola, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
